definitions.definition: A person who has not yet reached adulthood , whether natural ( puberty ), cultural ( initiation ), or legal ( majority ).
examples: Regular chores can be appropriate for children , given age-appropriate limits on difficulty level and time on task.

definitions.definition: One's direct descendant by birth , regardless of age ; one's offspring ; a son or daughter .
examples: My youngest child is forty-three this year.
His adult children visit him yearly.

subdefinitions.definition: A person considered a product of a place or culture , a member of a tribe or culture, regardless of age.
examples: He is a child of his times.

subdefinitions.definition: Anything derived from or caused by something.
A data item , process , or object which has a subservient or derivative role relative to another.
examples: The child node then stores the actual data of the parent node.

definitions.definition: Alternative form of childe ( “ youth of noble birth ” ) .
A subordinate node of a tree .

main_definition: ( broadly ) A person who has not yet reached adulthood , whether natural ( puberty ), cultural ( initiation ), or legal ( majority ).
secondary_definitions: ( with possessive ) One's direct descendant by birth , regardless of age ; one's offspring ; a son or daughter .
Alternative form of childe ( “ youth of noble birth ” ) .
( mathematics , programming ) A subordinate node of a tree .
( obsolete , specifically ) A female child, a girl .
